me.description: > who i am, what i do

items.content: I'm Ignacio Figueroa, I study programming at UTN and I love learning on my own. I like exploring new technologies and seeing what I can do with them. For me, programming is a cool challenge and a way to create useful and creative things.

I like building my own projects, from small components to complete apps. Each project is an excuse to try new ideas and learn. I'm really into frontend, making clean and nice-looking interfaces, but I also love understanding how everything works behind the scenes.

I work by trying things out, making mistakes, and adjusting until it's right. I read, look at examples, and then apply it to real projects. I like documenting what I learn and sharing it on my portfolio or blog.

What motivates me most is learning, creating, and experimenting. I really enjoy solving problems, discovering new tools, and improving what I do. Every line of code is an opportunity to learn something and grow, and I always try to make my projects reflect my curiosity and the passion I put into programming.
